鐤（拼音：dǐng、zhēn）是非通用汉字，释义同“鼎”。
鐤 (pinyin: dǐng, zhēn) is a non-universal Chinese character with the same meaning as " ding ".

鐤字的基本解释

鐤
dǐng
古同“鼎”。

鐤字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dǐng］
［《廣韻》都挺切，上迥，端。］
亦作“鐤1”。亦作“鼑1”。
(1)古代炊器，又为盛熟牲之器。多用青铜或陶土制成。圆鼎两耳三足，方鼎两耳四足。盛行于商周。多用为宗庙的礼器和墓葬的明器。
(2)相传夏禹铸九鼎，历商至周，为传国的重器。后遂以指代国家政权和帝位。
(3)古时烹杀罪人的刑具。
(4)炼丹煮药之器。
(5)卦名之一。巽下离上，去故取新之象。
(6)引申为更新。参见“鼎新革故”。
(7)显赫，盛大。参见“鼎族”、“鼎貴”。
(8)比喻三公、宰辅、重臣之位。
(9)指地位和功名。
(10)比喻三方并立之势。参见“鼎立”、“鼎足”。
(11)最，顶。
(12)量词。
(13)副词。表示正在进行或正处于某种状态。相当于“正”、“正当”、“方”。参见“鼎盛”、“鼎來”。
(14)姓。宋有鼎澧。见《奇姓通》。

鐤字的康熙字典解释
鐤字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
鐤字的起名意思

暂无。

鐤
Basic explanation of words
鐤
dǐng
The ancient same "ding".
鐤
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dǐng］
["Guangyun" is very cut, on the jong, and at the end. ]
Also known as "鐤1". Also known as "Tao 1".
(1) Ancient cooking utensils are also used for cooking animals. It is mostly made of bronze or clay. Yuanding has two ears and three legs, while Fangding has two ears and four legs. Popular in the Shang and Zhou dynasties. It is mostly used as ceremonial objects in the ancestral temple and Ming objects in tombs.
(2) According to legend, Xia Yu cast Jiuding, from Shang to Zhou, which was the key to spreading the country. Later, it used to refer to the state power and throne.
(3) The torture device used to cook and kill criminals in ancient times.
(4) A device for alchemy and boiling medicine.
(5) One of the hexagram names. Sunda goes down and leaves up, go from the old to the new image.
(6) Extended to update. See "Dingxin Revolution".
(7) Prominent and grand. See "Ding Clan", "Ding Gui".
(8) It is a metaphor for the position of San Gong, Zaifu, and important minister.
(9) Refers to status and fame.
(10) It is a metaphor for the trilateral situation. See "Ding Li", "Ding Zu".
(11) Most, top.
(12) Quantifiers.
(13) Adverbs. Indicates that it is in progress or in a certain state. It is equivalent to "zheng", "just" and "fang". See "Dingsheng", "Dinglai".
(14) Last name. Song You Dingli. See "Qi Xing Tong".
